title: VirtualMedia.0.94.0
description: This is the schema definition for the Virtual Media Service.
specification: This resource shall be used to represent a virtual media service for a Redfish implementation.

ImageName.specification: The value of this property shall be the name of the image.

Image.description: A URI providing the location of the selected image
Image.specification: The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *extref*.  A null value indicated no image connection.

items.description: This is the media types supported as virtual media.

enumDescriptions.USBStick: An emulation of a USB storage device

items.specification: The values of this array shall be the supported media types for this connection.  CD indicates a virtual CD shall be supported.  Floppy indicates a virtual floppy device shall be supported.  USBStick indicates a virtual USB memory stick shall be supported.  DVD indicates a virtual DVD shall be supported.

ConnectedVia.specification: The value of this property shall indicate the current connection method from a client to the virtual media represented by this resource.  A value of NotConnected shall indicate no connection is present.  A value of URI shall indicate that a remote connection via a URI reference type is being used.  A value of Applet shall indicate that an application is currently connected

Inserted.description: Indicates if virtual media is inserted in the virtual device.
Inserted.specification: The value of this property shall be used to indicate if media is present in the virtual media device.  This is usually only applicable to remoting of devices and not for image virtual media usage.

WriteProtected.description: Indicates the media is write protected.
WriteProtected.specification: The value of this property shall be used to indicate if the remote device media prevents writing to that media.

self.description: This is the URI of this resource.
self.specification: The value of this property shall reference the URI of this resource.

links.description: The object contains references to other resources.
